descript.abstract: This dataset contains only the Hennepin County portion of the 7 county parcel base and is derived from the larger dataset. The original dataset is a compilation of tax parcel polygon and point layers from the seven Twin Cities, Minnesota metropolitan area counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington. The seven counties were assembled into a common coordinate system. No attempt has been made to edgematch or rubbersheet between counties. A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. (See section 5 of the metadata). The attributes are the same for the polygon and points layers. Not all attributes are populated for all counties. The polygon layer contains one record for each real estate/tax parcel polygon within each county's parcel dataset. Some counties have polygons for each individual condominium, and others do not. (See Completeness in Section 2 of the metadata for more information.) The points layer includes the same attribute fields as the polygon dataset. The points are intended to provide information in situations where multiple tax parcels are represented by a single polygon. The primary example of this is the condominium, though some counties stacked polygons for condos. Condominiums, by definition, are legally owned as individual, taxed real estate units. Records for condominiums may not show up in the polygon dataset. The points for the point dataset often will be randomly placed or stacked within the parcel polygon with which they are associated. The polygon layer is broken into individual county shape files. The points layer is provided as both individual county files and as one file for the entire metro area. In many places a one-to-one relationship does not exist between these parcel polygons or points and the actual buildings or occupancy units that lie within them. There may be many buildings on one parcel and there may be many occupancy units (e.g. apartments, stores or offices) within each building. Additionally, no information exists within this dataset about residents of parcels. Parcel owner and taxpayer information exists for many, but not all counties. Polygon and point counts for each county are as follows (Updated annually, current as of 1/15/2014): polygons / points Anoka - 130052 / 130052 Carver - 39639 / 39639 Dakota - 138356 / 151873 Hennepin - 425977 / 425977 Ramsey - 148841 / 166648 Scott - 55732 / 55732 Washington - 105525 / 105525 This is a MetroGIS Regionally Endorsed dataset. (See http://www.metrogis.org/data/about/index.shtml#whatis for more information.) Each of the seven Metro Area counties has entered into a multiparty agreement with the Metropolitan Council to assemble and distribute the parcel data for each county as a regional (seven county) parcel dataset. Additional information may be available in the individual metadata for each county at the links listed below. Also, any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata. Anoka = http://www.anokacounty.us/315/GIS Carver = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/carv_parcels.html Dakota = http://www.co.dakota.mn.us/homeproperty/propertymaps/pages/default.aspx Hennepin = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/Henn_TaxableParcels.html Ramsey = http://www.co.ramsey.mn.us/is/gisdata.htm Scott = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/scot_parcels.html Washington = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/wash_parcels.html
descript.purpose: To view, analyze and display parcel data anywhere in the seven county metro area.

idinfo.useconst: See license agreement for complete detailss http://www.metrogis.org/data/datasets/parcels/public/license.pdf . The license agreement sets forth the conditions that the user must observe when using the Regional Parcel Dataset. The person requesting this dataset is expected to communicate these conditions to all individuals in their respective organizations that will have access to this dataset. Licensed Public Parties have the right to use the data only for their own internal business purposes. No redistribution is permitted. Products made using the regional parcel dataset, including paper maps, .pdf files or other images of a finished map, are not subject to the provisions of the Parcel Data Sharing Agreement. Licensed users may distribute such map products in a manner they desire, provided the underlying source electronic parcel data are not accessible by the map recipient(s). The license agreement is a site license. Multiple copies of the data may be used by a licensed organization. Licensed Public Parties may have a Third Party use these data on their behalf, but the Third Party cannot use the data for any other purpose. A Third Party must obtain a license in addition to the license required for the qualifying Public Party interest. The Public Party is responsible for providing the data or password to its Third Party and ensuring compliance with the license conditions concerning use of the data by their Third Party. A Third Party user may include any interest that obtains access to the dataset for the express purpose of assisting a Public Party in utilizing the data.

Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

overview.eaover:
A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. The attributes are identical for the point and polygon datasets. Not all attributes fields are populated by each county.
A list of the attribute names is shown below. Detailed information about the attributes can be found at: http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/MetroGIS_Regional_Parcels_Attributes.pdf
Field Name: Brief Description ------------- -------------------- COUNTY_ID: Unique County ID
PIN: Unique Parcel ID
BLDG_NUM: House Number PREFIX_DIR: Street Prefix Direction PREFIXTYPE: Street Prefix Type STREETNAME: Street Name STREETTYPE: Street Type SUFFIX_DIR: Street Suffix Direction UNIT_INFO: Unit Information
CITY: City (actual) CITY_USPS: City (mailing)
ZIP: ZIP Code ZIP4: ZIP 4 Extension
PLAT_NAME: Legal Description Plat Name BLOCK: Legal Description Block LOT: Legal Description Lot
ACRES_POLY: Polygon Acreage ACRES_DEED: Deeded Acreage
USE1_DESC: Use Type 1 USE2_DESC: Use Type 2 USE3_DESC: Use Type 3 USE4_DESC: Use Type 4
MULTI_USES: Multiple Uses
LANDMARK: Landmark/Business Name
OWNER_NAME: Owner Name OWNER_MORE: Additional Owner Name
OWN_ADD_L1: Owner Address Line 1 OWN_ADD_L2: Owner Address Line 2 OWN_ADD_L3 Owner Address Line 3
TAX_NAME: Taxpayer Name
TAX_ADD_L1: Taxpayer Address Line 1 TAX_ADD_L2: Taxpayer Address Line 2 TAX_ADD_L3: Taxpayer Address Line 3
HOMESTEAD: Homestead Status
EMV_LAND: Est. Market Value - Land EMV_BLDG: Est. Market Value - Buildings EMV_TOTAL: Est. Market Value - Total
TAX_CAPAC: Tax Capacity TOTAL_TAX: Total Tax
SPEC_ASSES: Special Assessments
TAX_EXEMPT: Tax Exempt Status
XUSE1_DESC: Exempt Use 1 XUSE2_DESC: Exempt Use 2 XUSE3_DESC: Exempt Use 3 XUSE4_DESC: Exempt Use 4
DWELL_TYPE: Dwelling Type HOME_STYLE: Home Style FIN_SQ_FT: Square Footage
GARAGE: Garage Y/N GARAGESQFT: Garage Square Footage
BASEMENT: Basement Y/N
HEATING: Heating type COOLING: Cooling type
YEAR_BUILT: Year Built
NUM_UNITS: Number of Units
SALE_DATE: Last Sales Date SALE_VALUE: Last Sales Value
SCHOOL_DST: School District WSHD_DIST: Watershed District
GREEN_ACRE: Green Acres OPEN_SPACE: Open Space AG_PRESERV: Agricultural Preserve AGPRE_ENRD: Ag. Preserve Enrolled AGPRE_EXPD: Ag. Preserve Expiration
PARC_CODE: Parcel Polygon to Parcel Point and PIN Relationship Code
overview.eadetcit:
A detailed description of the attributes available in this dataset can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/MetroGIS_Regional_Parcels_Attributes.pdf
Note: The last five digits of Dakota Counties PIN Numbers changed format in March of 2011 See .pdf above for further details.
A lookup table "ParcelsDakotaOldNewPINLookupTable2011.dbf" will be included in the Dakota County zip bundle that allows users to join parcel information which contain the old PIN format. Users should be aware that the old and new PIN formats are not mutually exclusive to each other. There are approximately 1,500 records of NEWPIN numbers that have the same PIN as OLDPIN number.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
